articles.author: BILL BARROW and JONATHAN J. COOPER
articles.description: TUSCALOOSA, Ala. (AP) — Nikki Haley was targeted Wednesday from the opening moments of the fourth debate for Republican presidential hopefuls as time runs out for the shrinking field to shake up a race dominated by former President Donald Trump.
articles.title: Nikki Haley is targeted in the fourth Republican debate by her rivals. They all trail Trump

articles.author: KEN RITTER and RIO YAMAT
articles.description: LAS VEGAS (AP) — A gunman killed three people and critically wounded a fourth Wednesday at the University of Nevada, Las Vegas before being killed in a shootout with police, authorities said. The attack sent shock waves through a city still scarred by the deaths of 60 people in a 2017 mass shooting only a few miles away on the famous Strip.
articles.title: Police say 3 dead, fourth wounded and shooter also dead in University of Nevada, Las Vegas attack

articles.author: STEVE PEOPLES and NICHOLAS RICCARDI
articles.description: With the Iowa caucuses rapidly approaching, a shrinking field of Republican White House hopefuls gathered Wednesday in Alabama for the fourth presidential debate. As usual, former President Donald Trump, who is dominating the GOP primary, didn’t appear.
articles.title: GOP rivals take on Haley in effort to blunt her rise, and other takeaways from the Republican debate

articles.author: NAJIB JOIBAIN, JACK JEFFERY and LEE KEATH
articles.description: RAFAH, Gaza Strip (AP) — Israeli troops battled Hamas militants Wednesday in the center of the Gaza Strip's second-largest city, the military said, pressing a ground offensive that has sent tens of thousands of Palestinians fleeing to the territory's southernmost edge and prevented aid groups from delivering food, water and other supplies.
articles.title: Fighting between Israel and Hamas rages in Gaza's second-largest city, blocking aid from population

articles.author: ZEKE MILLER, AAMER MADHANI and STEPHEN GROVES
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — As Senate Republicans blocked the advance of tens of billions of dollars in military and economic assistance for Ukraine Wednesday, President Joe Biden berated their tactics as “stunning" and dangerous.
articles.title: As Ukraine aid falters in the Senate, Biden signals he's willing to make a deal on border security

articles.author: TARA COPP
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — The military announced late Wednesday it was grounding all of its Osprey V-22 helicopters, one week after eight Air Force Special Operations Command service members died in a crash off the coast of Japan.
articles.title: US military grounds entire fleet of Osprey aircraft following a deadly crash off the coast of Japan

articles.author: GABE STERN
articles.description: RENO, Nev. (AP) — A Nevada grand jury on Wednesday indicted six Republicans who submitted certificates to Congress falsely declaring Donald Trump the winner of the 2020 presidential election in their state, making Nevada the third to seek charges against so-called “fake electors.”
articles.title: Nevada grand jury indicts six Republicans who falsely certified that Trump won the state in 2020

articles.author: ALI SWENSON and MICHELLE R. SMITH
articles.description: Former President Donald Trump is urging supporters to “guard the vote” during next year's election, a phrase that has set off alarm bells among pro-democracy advocates who say it signals permission to take extreme measures that could intimidate voters and threaten election workers.
articles.title: Trump tells supporters, 'Guard the vote.' Here’s the phrase's backstory and why it's raising concern

articles.author: LYNN ELBER
articles.description: LOS ANGELES (AP) — Norman Lear, the writer, director and producer who revolutionized prime time television with "All in the Family," “The Jeffersons” and “Maude,” propelling political and social turmoil into the once-insulated world of TV sitcoms, has died.
articles.title: Norman Lear, producer of TV's 'All in the Family' and influential liberal advocate, has died at 101

articles.author: FRANKLIN BRICEÑO and REGINA GARCIA CANO
articles.description: LIMA, Peru (AP) — Peru’s former President Alberto Fujimori was released from prison Wednesday on humanitarian grounds, despite a request from a regional human rights court to delay his release.
articles.title: Former Peruvian President Alberto Fujimori is freed from prison on humanitarian grounds
